definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: The lap-dog knew many tricks, and was a great favourite with his master.
sentences.chinese: 哈巴狗卻會很多的鬼把戲，深得主人的寵愛。

sentences.english: Is this a dirty trick of Mother Nature?
We quickly saw through his trick.
sentences.chinese: 我們很快看穿了他的鬼把戲。

sentences.english: He thought he could fool people with transparent deceptions.
sentences.chinese: 他以爲他能用那些可以一眼看穿的鬼把戲愚弄人。

sentences.english: The police has wised up their game.
sentences.chinese: 警察識破了他們的鬼把戲。

sentences.english: This is one of his jokes, and no mistake.
sentences.chinese: 這是他的鬼把戲，肯定錯不了。

sentences.english: So what kind of pranks do people play on April Fool’s Day?
sentences.chinese: 那麼在愚人節人們會玩什麼樣的鬼把戲呢？

sentences.english: I can see through your little game.
